    public class MainActivity
extends androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
    Main activity, the main menu so to speak. It displays navigation bar, it handles fragments and overall logic of the app. "root" class

      • onCreate

        protected void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Creates the activity. It is the frame which hosts all fragments, it also handles communication between them
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState: - previously saved instance data. In this case it will contain obtained question when the app is open via the push notification.

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        Handles pressed back button, hitting it on home fragment exits to phone's home screen when user is currently on different fragment app goes to home/current weather
        Overrides:
        onBackPressed in class androidx.activity.ComponentActivity

      • onConfigurationChanged

        public void onConfigurationChanged(@NonNull
                                   android.content.res.Configuration newConfig)
        Called by the system when the device configuration changes while your activity is running. Note that this will only be called if you have selected configurations you would like to handle with the R.attr.configChanges attribute in your manifest. If any configuration change occurs that is not selected to be reported by that attribute, then instead of reporting it the system will stop and restart the activity (to have it launched with the new configuration). It is called because of: in manifest.
        Specified by:
        onConfigurationChanged in interface android.content.ComponentCallbacks
        Overrides:
        onConfigurationChanged in class androidx.appcompat.app.AppCompatActivity
        Parameters:
        newConfig: - The new device configuration. This value must never be null.

      • onWindowFocusChanged

        public void onWindowFocusChanged(boolean hasFocus)
        When user changes the window he's focused on, the app should be still fullscreen.
        Specified by:
        onWindowFocusChanged in interface android.view.Window.Callback
        Overrides:
        onWindowFocusChanged in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        hasFocus: - says if it's fullscreen or running in the background.

      • switchFragment

        private void switchFragment(androidx.fragment.app.Fragment fragment,
                            java.lang.Boolean isUpdate)
        Handles fragment switching. As a bonus it refreshes response fragment when it is currently visible and the new question has arrived
        Parameters:
        fragment: - new fragment that should be visible.
        isUpdate: - boolean flag that tells if it is regular fragment switch via navigation bar or it is a change forced by push notification.

      • delayFragment

        private void delayFragment(androidx.fragment.app.Fragment fragment,
                           int timeInSeconds)
        It switcehs a new fragment with a certain time delay. It is made so to ensure that the previous transaction has finished.
        Parameters:
        fragment: - new fragment.
        timeInSeconds: - time delay.

      • hideSystemUI

        private void hideSystemUI()
        Hides the system UI with several flags. Sets the IMMERSIVE flag. Sets the content to appear under the system bars so that the content doesn't resize when the system bars hide and show.

      • onPause

        protected void onPause()
        System method called when the app stops being visible. Here it is also destroyed reference to push notification broadcast receiver.
        Overrides:
        onPause in class androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity

      • onResume

        protected void onResume()
        System method called when the app is moved from background, It also creates reference to push notification broadcast receiver.
        Overrides:
        onResume in class androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity

      • handleForegroundPush

        public void handleForegroundPush(androidx.fragment.app.Fragment frg)
        Changes fragment upon receiving a new push notification.
        Parameters:
        frg: - new fragment, presumably response fragment.
